data.title: Max Mirnyi has to answer to majestic Andy Murray
data.meta_description: Andy Murray cruised into the second round of the St Petersburg Open with a 6-2, 6-2 victory over Max Mirnyi. Murray, sidelined for much of the year by a wrist injury, had shown himself to be back to
data.text:
Andy Murray cruised into the second round of the St Petersburg Open with a 6-2, 6-2 victory over Max Mirnyi.

Murray, sidelined for much of the year by a wrist injury, had shown himself to be back to somewhere approaching his best form last week in pushing Rafael Nadal all the way before ultimately bowing out in the third round of the Madrid Masters.

Mirnyi, the world number 121, had no answer to Murrayâ€™s all-round game, the Belarussian unable to respond after having his serve broken early in both sets.

Having taken the first set comfortably Murray raced into a 5-1 lead in the second and closed out the match in just 52 minutes.

Murray, the second seed, plays Lukas Dlouhy of the Czech Republic
